greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Partial sums of the Dirichlet inverse of the Euler totient function.
comment: The matrix A191898 seen as a 2n X 2n block matrix A = {{a, b},{c, d}} where a, b, c and d are n X n matrices, A191898 has the property that the sum: 1 - a - d = trace(A191898). This is demonstrated by the second Mathematica program below.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} k * mu(k) * floor(n/k), where mu(k) is the Moebius function. - _Daniel Suteu_, Jun 11 2018
maple: a_list := len -> ListTools:-PartialSums([seq(mul(1-i, i=numtheory:-factorset(k)), k=1..len)]): a_list(49); # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 20 2016
mathematica: Clear[a, n, d]; a[n_] := If[n < 1, 0, Sum[d MoebiusMu@d, {d, Divisors[n]}]]; Accumulate[Table[a[n], {n, 1, 49}]] (* After Michael Somos in A023900 *)
Clear[nn, A, B, AB, n, k];
d = Table[Table[AB[[n, k]], {k, nn/2 + 1, nn}], {n, nn/2 + 1, nn}];
results.author: _Mats Granvik_, Jul 19 2016
